Blur was quietly following Kluster and the other Maximals.  His mind was
on something different however.  He couldn't help but look at the lion
bot.  She was, in his visual receptors, beautiful.  He forced himself to
talk slowly.  "So, Now that we're sittinghere.  What is the reason for
this meeting?"  He glanced back at the lioness. 

On Thu, 13 Jul 2000 15:04:23 -0000 cyberwolf4@... writes:
> "You don't have to sit in the corner my dear, I'm sure theres enough 
> seats for everybody, if theres not then you may have mine." Phobia 
> saw a combination of distrust and disbelief, mixxed in with 
> impatience and curiosity. she didn't see him as a guest, she just 
> saw 
> him as another Pred for the scrapheap.
> 
> "It's simple common sense and logic, I'm surrounded by Primus knows 
> how many Maximals, in a Maximal ship, without any major weapons to 
> fight with. Why would I do anything around here when the casino 
> planet wouldn't lay odds on my survival?" His words made sense but 
> he 
> knew that she wouldn't change her attitude toward him. Phobia just 
> sank down in a chair and waited for Klusters response to his wishes.
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, logomorph@h... wrote:
> > ::Savanna::
> > 
> > She looked at Phobia.  She was now very curious to find out what 
> was 
> > so important.  But she reminded herself that curiousity killed 
> that 
> > cat.  She followed them into the conference room.  She transformed 
> 
> > into bot mode and walked to a corner of the room.  She wanted room 
> 
> to 
> > move incase of trouble.
> > 
> > 
> > 
> > --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, cyberwolf4@p... wrote:
> > > Phobia was nearly impressed by the condition of the ship, but he 
> 
> > > fealt a flaw about it's leader, what kind of leader crashes his 
> > ship 
> > > on it's first mission?
> > > 
> > > the words "fully functional" echoed in Phobias ears,this ship 
> could 
> > > be the edge the Maximals need to save this planet, the only 
> problem 
> > > would be getting it to fly again. That would be a problem for 
> the 
> > > techbots not him, and the problem at hand had to be discussed 
> first.
> > > 
> > > "I understand your precautions, I'd probably do no less if the 
> > > situation were reversed." He knew better though. if the 
> situation 
> > > were reversed a predicon would have blown them to bits by now 
> and 
> > > taken the information. The spider was glad that the Maximals 
> were 
> > > diplomatic creatures.
> > > 
> > > "If at all possible I would like you're science officer, your 
> > > tactical officer, and every available Maximal leader in on our 
> > > conference.
> > > 
> > > (If your answers yes then arrange temporary quarters for Phobia 
> > > somewhere, if you don't trust him then I'm sure you have room in 
> 
> > the 
> > > brig until the meeting.)
> > > 
> > > (If your answers no then)"Do you at least have someone available 
> 
> > with 
> > > knowledge of temporal physics?" Phobia asks, confident that the 
> > > question just stumped Kluster. "We will need them present, I'm 
> not 
> > > all that great with history."
> 
>
